Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll

Class CourseRoll

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll.CourseRoll
public class CourseRoll extends Object
CourseRoll class that helps a student enroll, drop and checks that ensure that a student can enroll in a class This class uses various methods to ensure that the student is added to the class or to the waitlist and the order in which the student will be added from the waitlist.
Author:
Siddhant Joshi, Arnav Ganguly, Shaurya Deepak

  • Constructor Details

    • CourseRoll

      public CourseRoll(int enrollmentCap, Course course)
      Constructs a CourseRoll with the given enrollment capacity.
      Parameters:
      enrollmentCap - the maximum number of students allowed to enroll in the course
      course - is the course this course roll is associated with
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if enrollmentCap is less than MIN_ENROLLMENT or greater than MAX_ENROLLMENT

  • Method Details

    • setEnrollmentCap

      public void setEnrollmentCap(int enrollmentCap)
      Sets the enrollment capacity for the course.
      Parameters:
      enrollmentCap - the maximum number of students allowed to enroll in the course
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if enrollmentCap is not within the valid range

    • getEnrollmentCap

      public int getEnrollmentCap()
      Gets the maximum enrollment capacity for the course.
      Returns:
      the maximum number of students allowed to enroll in the course

    • getOpenSeats

      public int getOpenSeats()
      Gets the number of open seats left in the course.
      Returns:
      the number of open seats for the course

    • enroll

      public void enroll(Student s)
      This method enrolls a student in the course or in the waitlist. If the class is full (there are no open seats), then the student is added to the waitlist.
      Parameters:
      s - the student to be enrolled
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the student cannot be enrolled (e.g., no open seats in class or waitlist or already enrolled)

    • drop

      public void drop(Student s)
      This method drops a student from the course. If the student is in the roll (already enrolled in class) the student is dropped from the course and the first student in the waitlist is added to the roll. If the student is in the waitlist, the student is simply removed and the order of the waitlist is maintained
      Parameters:
      s - the student to be dropped from the course
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided student is null

    • canEnroll

      public boolean canEnroll(Student s)
      Checks if a student can enroll in the course.
      Parameters:
      s - the student trying to enroll
      Returns:
      true if the student is allowed to enroll
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided student is null

    • getNumberOnWaitlist

      public int getNumberOnWaitlist()
      This is the method that returns the number of students on the wait list
      Returns:
      the number of students on the wait list
